firmware_notes: Basado en TAPR TNC-2 firmware original (1985). Firmware estándar 1.1.8 y 1.1.9. Compatible con clones: MFJ-1270B/1274, PacComm TINY-2/MICRO-2, Symek TNC-2H, AEA PK-88, Kantronics KPC-2/KPC-3, etc. Procesador: Z80 @ 4.9152 MHz. Memoria: 32K EPROM + 32K RAM.

Connection.help:
Initiates an AX.25 connection to the specified station.

Examples:
  C DG2GSV
  C DB0UAL VIA DG2GSV
  C DB0FHN VIA DB0UAL,DB0RBS
  C W1AW-5

The TNC sends SABM frames and waits for UA. If no response after RETRY attempts, connection fails.

Up to 8 digipeaters can be specified in the VIA path.

Sends a DISC frame to end the current AX.25 connection gracefully.

Waits for UA response before fully disconnecting.

Enters converse mode. Everything you type is packetized and transmitted.

Press Ctrl+C three times (with 1 second before/after) to return to command mode.

Short form: K

Enters transparent mode for binary data transfer.

All data is passed without interpretation.
Use three Ctrl+C characters (COMMAND) with timing to exit.

Useful for file transfers and remote terminal access.

Monitoring.help:
Enables or disables the display of packets on the radio channel.

MON ON  – show monitored traffic
MON OFF – only show data from connected station

Default: ON

When ON, monitors all packets regardless of destination.

When OFF, only monitors packets to/from your station.

Default: ON

When ON, only shows packets from stations you're connected to.

Default: OFF

Controls whether monitored traffic is shown during active connections.

Default: OFF

When ON, shows digipeated packets.

Default: OFF

When ON, displays packet header on separate line from data.

When OFF, header and data on same line.

Default: ON

Displays a list of stations heard recently.

Shows callsign, packets heard, and last heard time.

Sets screen width for word wrap.

Values: 0-255 (0 = disabled)
Default: 0

When enabled, wraps text at specified column.

Station Setup.help:
Sets the callsign used for all transmissions.

Examples:
  MY EA7HQL
  MY EA7HQL-5

SSID (-0 to -15) can be appended. Default SSID is -0.

You MUST set this before connecting. TNC will prompt on first power-up.

Sets alternate identifier for digipeating.

Example: MYALIAS MADRID

Stations can digipeat via MYCALL or MYALIAS.
Useful for geographic or functional names.

Default: none

Controls whether the TNC echoes back characters you type.

ECHO ON  – TNC echoes input
ECHO OFF – no echo (use if terminal has local echo)

Default: ON

Adds LF after each CR received from computer.

Default: OFF

Enables XON/XOFF software flow control between TNC and terminal.

Uses START (Ctrl+Q) and STOP (Ctrl+S) characters.

Default: ON

When ON, displays message when entering/exiting modes.

Example: *** CONNECTED to W1AW

Default: ON

Packet Timing.help:
Delay between keying TX and sending data.

Values: 0-120 (10ms units)
Default: 30 (300ms)

Guidelines:
  Direct VHF: 20-30
  Via repeater: 40-60
  HF: 30-50

Seconds to wait for ACK before retransmitting.

Values: 1-15
Default: 3

Guidelines:
  VHF direct: 3
  Via digipeater: 5-7
  HF: 8-15

Max retransmission attempts before disconnect.

Values: 0-15
Default: 10

CSMA persistence. Higher = more aggressive transmit.

Values: 0-255
Default: 63

Probability = (PERSIST + 1) / 256
  63 = 25% (shared channels)
  255 = always transmit (point-to-point)

Time interval between PERSIST checks.

Values: 0-255 (10ms units)
Default: 10 (100ms)

Used with PERSIST for p-persistent CSMA.

Time slots to wait after DCD drops before transmitting.

Values: 0-255
Default: 0

Each slot = SLOTTIME duration.
Increases delay after carrier detect drops.

Delay before responding to poll or connection.

Values: 0-250 (100ms units)
Default: 0

Useful for half-duplex systems.

Extra TXDELAY when transmitting through repeater.

Values: 0-255 (10ms units)
Default: 0

Added to TXDELAY if no activity heard within AXHANG time.

Repeater tail hang time.

Values: 0-255 (10ms units)
Default: 0

If packet heard within this time, AXDELAY not added.

Packet Advanced.help:
Maximum data bytes per AX.25 I-frame.

Values: 0-255 (0 = 256)
Default: 128

Guidelines:
  HF (300 baud): 40-80
  VHF (1200 baud): 128
  VHF (9600 baud): 255

Smaller = fewer retransmissions on noisy links.

Max unacknowledged I-frames before waiting for ACK.

Values: 1-7
Default: 4

Guidelines:
  HF: 1-2
  VHF simplex: 3-4
  VHF full-duplex: 7

Time with no activity before sending link check.

Values: 0-250 (10 sec units, 0=disabled)
Default: 30 (300 seconds = 5 minutes)

With AX25L2V2 ON: sends RR poll
With AX25L2V2 OFF: initiates disconnect

Prevents hung connections.

ON - use AX.25 v2.0 protocol (poll frames)
OFF - use AX.25 v1.0 protocol

v2.0 sends short poll frames instead of retransmitting full packets.
Reduces channel congestion.

Recommended ON for VHF/UHF.
Some suggest OFF for HF to reduce polling overhead.

Default: ON

Enables the digipeater function.

When ON, the TNC relays packets addressed via MYCALL or MYALIAS.

Default: ON (on TAPR TNC-2)

When ON, passes packets even with CRC errors.

Useful for monitoring weak signals.

Default: OFF

ON - use PERSIST/SLOTTIME method
OFF - use DWAIT method

Default: ON

Most modern operations use ON.

Beacon & Unproto.help:
Sets beacon transmission:

EVERY n - send beacon every n×10 seconds
AFTER n - send once after n×10 sec of inactivity

Values: 0-250 (0 = off)
Default: EVERY 0 (disabled)

Examples:
  BEACON EVERY 90 (every 15 minutes)
  BEACON AFTER 180 (after 30 min inactivity)
  BEACON EVERY 0 (disable)

WARNING: Use beacons sparingly! Keep short and infrequent.
More than once per 10 minutes is excessive.

Sets the text for beacon packets. Max 128 characters.

Example: BTEXT EA7HQL VHF Packet - Madrid

Beacon sent as UI frame to BEACON destination via UNPROTO path.

Default: empty

Sets destination and digipeater path for UI frames (beacons, unconnected packets).

Examples:
  UNPROTO CQ
  UNPROTO BEACON VIA WIDE2-2
  UNPROTO APRS VIA RELAY,WIDE

Up to 8 digipeaters can be specified.

Default: CQ

Immediately sends an identification packet.

Packet contains MYCALL in UI frame to destination ID.

Useful for sending final ID before shutdown.

When ON, sends ID beacon every 9.5 minutes when digipeating.

Firmware 1.1.9+: Also sends ID on connect, disconnect, and connect attempts.

Format: MYCALL>ID via UNPROTO

Default: OFF

Connect Messages.help:
Message sent to station that connects to you.

Max 128 characters.

Example: CTEXT Welcome to EA7HQL - Madrid

Default: empty

When ON, automatically sends CTEXT when someone connects.

Default: OFF

When ON, displays '*** CONNECTED to {call}' message.

Default: ON

Mode to enter automatically after successful connection:

CONVERSE - enter converse mode
TRANS - enter transparent mode

Default: CONVERSE

When ON, stays in converse mode even after disconnect.

Default: OFF

Packet Timing Control.help:
Send packet after n×100ms of inactivity from terminal.

Values: 0-250 (100ms units)
Default: AFTER 10 (1 second)

Sends partial packet if no data for specified time.

When ON, PACTIME applies in converse mode.
When OFF, PACTIME ignored in converse.

Default: ON

Character that forces immediate packet transmission.

Format: $xx where xx is hex ASCII code
Default: $0D (CR)

Examples:
  SENDPAC $0D (carriage return)
  SENDPAC $05 (Ctrl+E)

Set to $00 to disable.

When ON, CR character is added to outgoing data.
When OFF, CR is stripped from outgoing data.

Default: ON

Serial Port.help:
Sets data bits for serial port.

Values: 7, 8
Default: 7

Note: TAPR TNC-2 standard is 7E1 (7 data, Even parity, 1 stop)
Set to 8 for 8N1 operation with 8BITCONV ON.

When ON, allows 8-bit characters (high bit set).
When OFF, strips high bit (7-bit only).

Requires AWLEN 8.

Default: OFF

Enables XON/XOFF software flow control.

Same as FLOW command.

Default: ON

When ON, TNC honors flow control from computer.
When OFF, ignores flow control.

Default: ON

Sets the XON (resume) character for flow control.

Default: $11 (Ctrl+Q)

Format: $xx where xx is hex ASCII code.

Sets the XOFF (pause) character for flow control.

Default: $13 (Ctrl+S)

Format: $xx where xx is hex ASCII code.

Special Characters.help:
Character that cancels current input line.

Default: $18 (Ctrl+X)

Format: $xx where xx is hex ASCII code.

Clears entire line being entered.

Character that toggles packet output on/off.

Default: $19 (Ctrl+Y)

Format: $xx where xx is hex ASCII code.

Sends TNC output to bit bucket when toggled on.

Character used to delete previous character.

Default: $08 (Ctrl+H / Backspace)

Format: $xx where xx is hex ASCII code.

Behavior affected by BKONDEL setting.

Character that redisplays current input line.

Default: $12 (Ctrl+R)

Format: $xx where xx is hex ASCII code.

Useful after using DELETE to see clean line.

Character sequence to exit transparent mode.

Default: $03 (Ctrl+C)

Format: $xx where xx is hex ASCII code.

Must send three COMMAND chars with CMDTIME spacing.

Guard time for escaping transparent mode.

Values: 0-255 seconds
Default: 1

Requires silence for CMDTIME, then three COMMAND chars with <CMDTIME spacing, then CMDTIME silence.

0 = can only exit via BREAK signal.

Controls DELETE character behavior:

ON - sends backspace (destructive)
OFF - sends \ character

Default: ON

Character to switch between connection streams (multi-connect TNCs).

Default: $00 (disabled on single-stream TNCs)

Format: $xx where xx is hex ASCII code.

Display.help:
Shows TNC parameter values.

No parameter - all settings
With parameter - single setting

Examples:
  DISP
  DISP PACLEN
  DISP TXDELAY

Enables JHOST binary protocol mode.

WARNING: Changes TNC to binary mode.
Use only with compatible host software.

Default: OFF

Enables KISS protocol mode.

WARNING: Changes TNC to KISS binary protocol.
Requires RESTART to take effect.
Use only with KISS-compatible software.

Default: OFF

Calibration.help:
Enters calibration mode for adjusting transmitter audio levels.

The TNC transmits alternating mark/space tones (1200/2200 Hz).
Adjust TX audio for proper deviation.

Press any key to exit.

Reset & Restart.help:
Resets ALL parameters to factory defaults.

WARNING: Erases callsign and all settings.

TNC will prompt for MYCALL after RESET.

Restarts TNC without clearing parameters.

Required after changing:
- KISS mode
- Some serial port settings

Saves current parameters.

Special Keys.help:
Three Ctrl+C characters (with proper timing) return to cmd: prompt.

Timing: silence for CMDTIME, send 3×Ctrl+C within CMDTIME of each other, silence for CMDTIME.

Default CMDTIME is 1 second.

Cancels (clears) current input line.

Default CANLINE character.

Toggles TNC output on/off (bit bucket).

Default CANPAC character.

Redisplays current input line.

Default REDISPLA character.
Useful after using DELETE/backspace.

Resumes output (XON).

Default START character for flow control.

Pauses output (XOFF).

Default STOP character for flow control.

Sends a serial BREAK signal.

Used for:
- Autobaud detection (some TNCs)
- Exiting transparent mode if CMDTIME=0
- Hardware reset on some clones

connectors.Computer Port (RS-232): DB-25 male (DTE). Pin 2: TxD (from computer), Pin 3: RxD (to computer), Pin 4: RTS (from computer), Pin 5: CTS (to computer), Pin 6: DSR (to computer), Pin 7: Signal GND, Pin 8: DCD (to computer), Pin 20: DTR (from computer). Standard EIA RS-232C.
connectors.Radio Port: 5-pin DIN 180° female. Pin 1: RX audio in (10K-100K impedance, ~100mV-1V p-p), Pin 2: Ground, Pin 3: PTT out (active low, open collector), Pin 4: TX audio out (AFSK, ~10mV-3V p-p adjustable), Pin 5: Ground.
connectors.Modem Disconnect: 2-pin header. Short to disable modem (allows external modem). Open for internal 1200 baud modem.
connectors.Power: 2-pin or coaxial. +12V DC nominal (9-15V acceptable), ~200mA typical, ~350mA peak. Polarity marked on board. Usually 2.1mm coax, center positive.

notes.standard_config: TAPR TNC-2 standard: 9600 baud, 7 data bits, Even parity, 1 stop bit (7E1). Modern operation often uses 9600 8N1 with AWLEN 8 and 8BITCONV ON.
notes.firmware_versions: Common firmware: TAPR 1.1.8 (1992), TAPR 1.1.9 (1994, adds CW ID, NMEA, enhanced monitoring). Third-party: TheNet (NORD><LINK), G8BPQ, WA8DED, others.
notes.clones: Many manufacturers produced TNC-2 compatibles: MFJ (1270B, 1274), PacComm (TINY-2, MICRO-2), Symek (TNC-2H, TNC-2S), AEA (PK-88), Kantronics (KPC-2, KPC-3), GLB (TNC-220), MJF, and dozens more worldwide.
notes.modem: Crystal-controlled 1200 baud Bell 202 AFSK modem. Mark: 1200 Hz, Space: 2200 Hz. TCM3105 modem IC standard. Some clones offer 9600 baud G3RUH option.
notes.processor: Zilog Z80 CPU @ 4.9152 MHz. Zilog Z80-SIO/0 dual UART. 32K EPROM (2764/27256), 32K SRAM (62256).
notes.protocol: Implements AX.25 v1.0 and v2.0 link layer protocol. Supports up to 8 digipeaters in path. Single connection (no multi-connect on standard firmware).
notes.operating_modes: Three modes: Command (cmd: prompt), Converse (data entry), Transparent (binary transfer). Most operation in Converse after connecting.
notes.power_consumption: Typical 200mA @ 12V (2.4W). Peak during transmit ~350mA. Very efficient for 24/7 operation.
notes.history: Designed by TAPR (Tucson Amateur Packet Radio) in 1985. Based on original TAPR TNC (1983). Became de facto standard for packet radio. Licensed to many manufacturers. Still widely used in APRS and emergency communications.
notes.tnc2_variants: TNC-2 clones added features: dual ports, mailbox, NET/ROM, multi-connect, GPS, APRS functions. Core command set remained compatible.
